tweets.text: Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/DvPy25LSuh

Found some #Aire white clawed #crayfish today.... but unfortunately all were dead. Not plague. 
Thanks @EnvAgencyYNE for quick, efficient response. 
Upper Aire Project #UAP site improving instream & riparian habitat to benefit these natives as well as trout et al @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/JqdDZON6tE

Here's @DaveThroupEA explaining what a big moment this is for our project, for all our partners @EnvAgency,@severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland for #TwaiteShad and for all fish on the #RiverSevern 🐟🐟🐟 #FishPassage #FollowTheShad @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW https://t.co/GFndvLcELB

Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/M5LzxjUZNu

Hi @EnvAgency & @thameswater strong sewage smell today from this sinister outfall on north bank of Yeading Brook at Ruislip Gardens. This stretch has been popular with kingfishers recently. River looking a bit milky🤢. 3 word location: “empty people then”. FYI @FriendsRivCrane https://t.co/aUPBD7Pvzp

Today is #bivisibilityday2020 , and in #construction I am proud to be an out Bi #Trans employee. Looking Back in 2017 we were proud to join up with @EnvAgency @balfourbeatty and @thames_barrier to run the first ever #BiVisibilityDay event in #construction https://t.co/hVebVEfqGk

tweets.text: The @InvasiveSp Floating Pennywort has been introduced from America. It can grow up to 20 cm a day & forms dense mats, disrupting the flow of water & the movement of animals. It also impacts the water temperature & dissolved oxygen levels, leading to fish deaths #PlantHealthWeek https://t.co/Ego9xtuyzB

tweets.text: Great. As per @EnvAgency timeless strapline, creating better places needs to be front and centre. Emma highlights good examples of local innovation. Join @EcosystemsNet for more. We share learning #UK wide! https://t.co/Ks31NtYY3k

@bettwsresident @Feargal_Sharkey @Countrymaned @EnvAgency @RibbleTrust @RibbleLife @JackPerksPhoto We need that too, we need it all Simon! More regulation alone won’t fix it,  more partnerships/collaborations alone won’t fix it, we need action on all fronts and in all contexts, home, work west minster and board rooms.
@RachSalv @EnvAgency What you mean there might be an organisation out there operating without anything that even looks like a functioning board. Oh, wait.
Toilet paper on the bank lower brook st. The outlet from the drain into the river by the road bridge is spilling sewage. #Ilkley @YorkshireWater @YWHelp https://t.co/ooSoCMsC0u

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Out of the office in Furlough,hiding from the SS.
Sharkey & Salvidge!!

By the way. Where is the @EnvAgency's annual accounts for 2019 - 20, were they not supposed to be published back in July?

https://t.co/4spPocBe8A
Spicey Beck #Ilkley sewage plume in the rain today @YorkshireWater @YWHelp https://t.co/1y3pJeiA6i

Thanks to a report from a member of the public, our #Warwickshire field team has removed this fallen tree from the River Alne #Alcester.

If left it could have caused a blockage to the water flow & led to #flooding. 

Please report blockages like this to us on 0800 807060. https://t.co/jXC7DqcNQp

Do you know the difference between aquatic weeds and algae?🧐

Some algae can be toxic whereas weeds are harmless so it is important to know when you need to call us📞

Our incident hotline is 0800 807060 #River https://t.co/xUMit0UtYt

This large willow tree was spanning the River Tame near Kingsbury #Warwickshire just upstream of a road bridge. 

We’ve cut it back before it detaches & blocks the bridge but we've left the base & lower limbs in the river so it can regrow, protect the bank & give cover for #fish https://t.co/JkArFSaq0h

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids What about the role of fresh river water; fishing; canoeing & the tourism industry that provides many jobs in Herefordshire? Are these to be sacrificed for industrial farming practise?  Is the huge increase in density of poultry in the county in itself a biohazard?

tweets.text:
Fisheries officers have removed an aeration kit from a site that has recovered following an algae crash after recent Thunderstorms. 

Here is a before and after pic of an algal sample from the site less than 24 hours apart.

Report fish in distress to 0800 80 70 60 #fish #water https://t.co/30Ii6ikDo9
Sewage at Mill Stream #Addingham today and sewage rags in tree. @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency https://t.co/9HwwjRDlaZ

Last week the @RSPCA_official rescued two swans from an oil spill in a waterway near Peakirk.

There have been several reports over the last month of oil in watercourses in that area which may have been illegally dumped. 

If you have seen anything please report it to 0800 807060 https://t.co/BWwickzi0G

Earlier today, and along with our partner agencies @EnvAgency & @DurhamCouncil we have handed the site of the Old Eldon Brickworks back to the site owner. All waste has been extinguished and the site will continue to be monitored over the coming days. Thank you for your support. https://t.co/sw1bVpuR9g

tweets.text:
Officers dealt with an oil pollution on the River Nene last week. 

The pollution was stopped and a clean-up was carried out within 24 hours of it being discovered.

These pictures were taken less than 19 hours apart and show the clean up. #Northamptonshire #pollution https://t.co/nUTZ3VaxNr
Our biodiversity team has been out in #Shropshire this week, releasing lots of lovely native water voles into the Rea Brook. Read more https://t.co/wNKn5Rpeno https://t.co/P7pcUNCYFK
One little fella discovers his new home in #Shropshire, where our biodiversity officers have this week released over 100 water voles https://t.co/wNKn5R7DvQ https://t.co/9iYM8wIvHF
Before and after pics. Our field team has been working in the Alcester area #Warwickshire to prevent blockages by clearing a fallen tree from the River Arrow #flood #teamEA https://t.co/hq5myIBzyW

We're working in partnership with @solihullcouncil @SoliLandscape improving 650 metres of the Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood for people and wildlife. Funded by the EA and ERDF @mhclg https://t.co/noaDncsfol

It's #PlantHealthWeek! @EnvAgency is working towards eradicating Water Primrose which is invading ponds, lakes, wetlands & waterways. This @InvasiveSp was introduced to the UK as an ornamental aquatic plant & is now banned from sale. For more: https://t.co/5crRIhAQUW
#BePlantWise https://t.co/EcD3WeS2uf

urls.title: Home - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: First published in 2008 and updated in 2015 the GB Invasive Non-native Species Strategy was developed to meet the challenge posed by invasive non-native species in Great Britain. This website provides tools and information for those working to support the strategy.

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @Countrymaned @EnvAgency @RibbleTrust @JackSpees @RibbleLife @JackPerksPhoto We need an enforced regulatory floor over which all this can work. Also soil warming due to climate change is/will release(ing) the huge store of soil P to watercourses whilst farmers still over-apply to be safe. This has to be recognised and managed or else we have no hope.

tweets.text:
As part of Mickletown FAS, we’ve worked with @BAMNuttall to make carbon savings during construction. 

By using clay and fill materials already on-site, we have removed 300 vehicle journeys! This has reduced:
-carbon emissions
-waste materials going to landfill
-noise

#flooding https://t.co/KoLjFaewjd

@Feargal_Sharkey this must be part of your case against @EnvAgency . Who knew we are importing 30,000 tonnes of human sewage into UK from Netherlands to spread on farmland. @AST_Salmon @GOVUK @guardian @guardianeco https://t.co/Hk49UHbmcB

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @EdwinBeatnik @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @EdwinBeatnik this pic shows the weir - which is basically a wall across the river that largely only fish who can leap, can - at a physical cost - get past. You can see where the bypass channel joins back to the river just below it https://t.co/9ETZimeXLS

You're going to have to tune in tomorrow night to find out.

You know it makes sense.

https://t.co/JPSyolWS2R

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust Will it work for eels and lampreys? It would be nice to see lateral low-flow areas to help them.

Really big day as first Severn water flows through brand new fish pass at Bevere #Worcestershire 

One of 4 being constructed by @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust 

When all complete next year will allow unrestricted fish passage up the Severn for 1st time in 160 years. https://t.co/fgwfIRMQ1B
